roleset.name: commerce: seller, giving in exchange for money
roleset.note: SELL-V NOTES: Member of VNcls give-13.1-1. (from sell.01-v)
SALE-N NOTES: Roleset based on sell.01. Verbnet class give-13.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from sale.01-n)
SELLING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on sell-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls give-13.1-1. (from selling.01-n)

example.name: sell-v: intransitive
example.text: They-1 have *trace*-1 to sell when things look like they're falling.
example.arg: when things look like they're falling

example.name: sell-v: Ergative
example.text: A painting by August Strindberg sold at auction in Stockholm.

example.name: sell-v: basic transitive
example.text: Dead-eyed men selling four-year-old copies of Cosmopolitan

example.name: sell-v: strange sellers
example.text: A more recent novel has sold more than 4 million copies.

example.name: sell-v: ergative with price
example.text: Individual copies sell for $3.95

example.name: sell-v: agentive with price
example.text: Al Brownstein sold it for $60 a bottle.

example.name: sell-v: semi-idiomatic
example.text: Day traders sell the company' stock short.

example.name: sell-v: with buyer
example.text: It will sell the ad time to its clients at a discount

example.name: sell-v: with benefactive
example.text: John sold his mother's house for her.

example.name: sale-n: Example with args 1, 2, and 3, but not 0 because of the interviening verb
example.text: it completed the sale of Phenix-Transmission Co. to BishopPipeline Co. , for $ 17 million in cash and notes
example.arg: for $ 17 million in cash and notes

example.name: sale-n: Example with args 0, 1, and 2
example.text: a Whitbread sale of brewing operations to Scottish& Newcastle

example.name: sale-n: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: The measure allows the sale of food and medicine to Cuba.

example.name: sale-n: Example with args 0, 1, and tmp
example.text: Her sale of the stock the day before the price collapsed.
example.arg: the day before the price collapsed

example.name: selling-n: just arg1
example.text: The most volatile form of program trading is index arbitrage -- the rapid - fire , computer - guided buying and selling of stocks

example.name: selling-n: arg0 and more argMs
example.text: Tokyo stocks closed easier , posting their first loss in six trading days , partly because of programmed index - linked selling by trust investment funds in the afternoon session .

example.name: selling-n: args 1 and 3
example.text: A "put option" allows the selling of the stock for a set price at a future date.

example.name: selling-n: arg2
example.text: Locals in that area are against selling of the house to a minority community family

example.name: selling-n: arg4
example.text: Thank you for all you did with the selling of the house for me.

example.name: sell_out-v: intransitive
example.text: John sold out.

example.name: sell_out-v: left
example.text: The Coalition of the Left and Progress had sold out its leftist tenets by collaborating in a right-wing plot aimed at ousting PASOK and thwarting the course of socialism in Greece.
example.arg: the coalition of the Left and Progress

example.name: sell_out-v: ergative
example.text: The new Harry Potter book sold out within 20 minutes.

example.name: sell_out-v: arg1 as PP
example.text: Amazon.com sold out of the new Harry Potter book within 20 minutes.
example.arg: of the new Harry Potter book

example.name: sell_off-v: turn a profit
example.text: He sold off the US$ 200 *U* check that *T* had been provided * for his airfare, bought a ticket for travel between Keelung and Kobe by ship, and handed the balance to his father.
example.arg: the US$ 200 *U* check that *T* had been provided * for his airfare.

example.name: sell_off-v: movin' to the city
example.text: They sold off thier land in the country, left their old homes, and moved to the city.

roleset.name: alternate expression of sell; put on sale, put up for sale
roleset.note: SALE-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01 Task 3. Framed by Claire. Comparison to sell. (from sale.01-v)

roles.note: See "sell" for examples of other arguments. (from sale.01-v)

example.name: sale-v: with expression of price
example.text: I have been searching for some time now , and I ca n't seem to find a dropshipper that-1 *-1 sales merchandise low enough so I could profit from it .
example.arg: so I could profit from it.

example.name: sale-v
example.text: Orange Box is selling like mad in my town right now, so they saled it, only 19.99 per box.
